text: I bought this bottle at Bierhandlung in Freiburg in Germany. I drank it at Paris in my hotel room. In my point of view, it is not really an amber ale but it sounds more a pale ale or IPA. It is an interesting beverage, perfectly refreshing and well balanced when your lips touches this beer. The taste is watery but it is nice with a perfect dosis of hop, resine notes, a little oily, sweet touch of grapefruit, malt and there is a mineral touch, coming from this natural water from the Schwarzwald and these forests. The carbonation is a regular, pleasant copper color, thin and white foam, good job!!!

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Dunkelrotes ale. Hellbeiger schaum, sieht alles klasse aus. Aroma voller roter Früchte, zusammen mit einer röstnote. Erinnert an die kalte Jahreszeit vor dem Kamin. Geschmeidiger Körper. Geht glatt runter, fast ölig. Im Abgang richtig fruchtig, tolle Einbettung des Alkohol.
26-11-16 // sample at CraftBeerMesse Mainz. Solid beer. Good malty body, light sweet. Good hop choice, they harmonise well giving the beer a nice fruity, citrus, light pine aroma.

Flasche 0,33l: Rötlicher Bernstein, leichte Trübung, kräftiger fester feinporiger Schaum; sehr frische und fruchtige Nase, angenehme Süße, exotische Früchte, frische Hopfennoten, etwas Karamell; im Körper kräftige fruchtige Bitterkeit, Grapefruit, Papaya, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, frische Hopfennoten; sehr angenehmer fruchtig-bitterer Nachgang mit kräftigen Hopfennoten

24/IX/16 - 33cl bottle @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: 3/II/17 (2016-1120) Thanks to bartlebier for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, creamy white head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: pretty fruity, citrus, some tropical fruits, pineapple, passion fruit. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, fruity, bit malty, citrus touch, pretty hoppy. Aftertaste: bitter, hoppy, bit metallic, grapefruit.

Zitrus und Ananasaromen fein eingebettet in einem leichten Malzteppich. Das schnuppert spitze. Auch für das Auge wird was geboten. Angetrübt, fast leuchtend, besticht das hellrostige Bier somit schon auf zwei Ebenen. Auf diesem Niveau bleibt es leider nicht, aber auch der säuerlich schlanke Trunk hat seine Momente. Citrus- und später Pinienflavours lassen die Hopfenkraft erstrahlen. Allerdings ist gerade der Antrunk ein wenig zu nüchtern und das Finale wiederum übertrieben alkoholisch. Also nicht gerade rund, vielmehr kantiges Craft Beer mit Blick über den Mainstream Tellerrand. Klasse. 0,33 l Flasche von BREWCOMER KIEL. Ca. 3.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2016 Bottle, thnx to bartlebier! Many thanks. Pours a clear amber beer with a nice white fluffy head on top. Aroma is quite malty and hoppy, has some vegetal notes in there. Flavor is mildly bitter, some citrussy hoppy notes, nothing too outspoken, light malty bready sweetness in the end. Fairly high carbonation, medium short bitter aftertaste. Decent.
From bottle, thanks, hazy deepish orange color, aroma of peach and citrus, some traits in flavor with a medium herbal bitterness. Good and easy.
[9/24/16] Bottle sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day two. Deep golden. Citric hops aroma with some graininess. Sweetish grainy flavor with bitterish citric hops.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 Several times this summer - Great fruity (citrus, sweet peach, apricot) aroma with pines and resin. Perfectly balanced sweet/dry/fruity red body. To complete this there comes (the best of it) a nice oily (Galaxy?) bit sweet hop finish wich i really like without any disturbing notes. My favourite amber and favourive local from Freiburg. Aroma and taste (truely) "- JE NACH TRINKTEMPERATUR." great!
Also a creative label design and name. Looking foreward to your next beer without beard. 09.11.2016 - One bottle somewhere in a tent between Båstad and Laholm. We had no problems cooling it ;)

Bottle sample BB 03.02.2017 @ Borefts 2016. Shared with RB Belgian crew. Danke Bartlebier.
Ambrée, col beige.
Nez finement houblonné, fruité léger avec un fin tropical et qcq notes dagrumes.
Palais est malté, caramel, pâle, ambre, houblonné reste correcte mais un peu en retrait par rapport aux versions US. Houblonnée retse frais, citronné vert avec un léger fini de pin. Le Chinook et Amarillo sont plus en avant.

Thank you bartlebier! 330 ml. bottle sampled @ Borefts 2016. Day 2. Hazy amber, toffee, little off-white head. Nose interesting, lightly fruity, bit cheesy, barn, fruity. Taste is a bit dull, fizzy, low barn hops, hay, rather empty with amber malts. Body is hay, bit thin & fizzy. Okay-ish, mildly interesting but overall not very exciting for me. P.S.: As suggested by the description paired with my beard.
Bottle shared. Hazy orange to red color, small white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, some hops, quite sweet with hints of peach and apricot. Average body and carbonation. Ok beer.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle at Borefts 2016, shared by bartlebier, thanks Frank! Slightly hazy, golden amber with a beige head. Slightly sweetish, moderately fruity-grassy aroma of fresh grass, citrus and some caramel. Slightly bitter, moderately grassy-fruity taste of caramel, citrus and some grass, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter and very dry finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nice!

Bottle by bartlebier, part of European Swap, many thanks. Pours deep golden color, white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, dried plums, caramel. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, malty, dried fruits, citrusy, caramel, tropical fruits, hoppy finish.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with small tan head. Aroma is berries, grapefruit hops, some caramel. Taste is grapefruit, caramel, fruchtgummi. Medium carbonation. Not bad!
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 Bottle at borefts 2016 day 2... Hazy Amber.. Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet floral fruit nose.. Juicy zezty orange
Weicher, getreidig karamelliger Antrunk. Herb, der Hopfen bleibt angenehm. Bitter würzig zum Ende. Gut trinkbar. 8/9/8/9//9
Bottle at Borefts, thanks for sharing. Caramel, malts, yeasty, pretty nice for an amber ale.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 The beer has got a hazy golden-amber colour with a steady head and medium t smooth body. Nice aroma of hops, biscuits and citrus. Taste of hops, citrus, pine, mandarina peel, lemon zest, herbs, biscuits and woods. dry-bitter finish. Great beer.

- dunkles Bernstein, mit leichter, aber haltbarer Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Citrusfrüchten, Malz und Aprikose
- passende Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk ist fruchtig, verbunden mit einer wunderbaren Würzigkeit
- der Körper ist schlank, aber nie wässrig
- im Mittelteil verbindet sich die Malzigkeit in perfekter Balance mit den Frucht-
 aromen und der Hopfenbitternis
- der Abgang hinterlässt dann einfach nur die Erinnerung an ein fabelhaftes
 Bier

Couleur ambrée orangée avec légère mousse. Fort nez houblonné fruits exotiques avec des notes caramelisées. Gout fruits exotiques ( litchi, pamplemousse, voir huile coco) avec caramel et houblon herbeux et résineux. Corps moyen . Fin avec bonne amertume fruitée et un peu résineuse. Vraiment bien pour juste 5.5c°. 
 
Amber orange color with light foam. Strong hoppy nose with exotic fruits and caramelized notes. Taste of exotic fruits (lychee, grapefruit, notes of coconut oil) with caramel and grassy-resinous hops . Medium body. End with good bitterness and slightly fruity and resinous. Really good for just 5.5c °.

Thank you Almuth for the gift!

About a cases worth of 33cl bb11/2016 (Sud 1), downed for libation and sampled at tastings over Freiburgs finicky summer. A delicate, precisely dialed-in mix of New World hops collide in this supremely sessionable West Coast-ish amber ale with auburn hues, loads of exotic hop oil goodness and a well-managed caramalt dryness. - Ar: passion fruit freshly juiced, candied dried mango slices going into earthy strawberry, a touch of chalky minerals. Carries through those sun-spoiled coastal hop aromas, adding quenching pine and citrus rind zestiness to the well-balanced mango and strawberry sweetness; a current of grainy tartness, bready sulphurs running through that. Finishes clean, crisp with a hint of those dry caramels and quinine resins preparing the palate for the next bottle without shifting into hop overdrive. Impressive first effort tweaked to high sessionability and in many respect a "brewers brew" that has instantly proved a darling of the local discerning demographic.

330ml bottle [Biere ohne Bart-lebier - unthinkable case of Emmancipation: thanks a lot for this one!]. Minimally milky, amber colour with average to huge, forthy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Intense fruity hoppy aroma, notes of red berries, strawberry, strawberry cake, some orange and mango as well, sadly a touch of glue at adverse instants. Taste is moderately bitter, fruity hoppy, notes of red berries, strawberry, hints of orange zest, minimally nuttily malty basis. Quite fragile, ephemeral composition.
Trübes dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach rotem malz, harzig hopfig. Geschmack harzig bitter, rotes malz, Pinien.
Pours an amber/golden color with white head. Light bitterness, citrus, tropical notes, malty notes.

0,33l bottle, bbe 24.11.16. Iridescent dark orange/yellow/red amber colour with a nice white head. Aroma is a lot of citrus fruit, mainly pink grapefruit, before a well balanced caramel/rock sugar background. Taste is a again a lot of pink grapefruit, tangerine, pine and a high but pleasant bitterness accompanied by a soft carbonation. Great beer for a hot summers evening and to start a sunny weekend. Well done!

Bottle 33cl, kindly given by Almut thanks. A slightly cloudy amber red beer with huge head, good retention and lacework. Nose is on dry carared malt, light berries, ripped fruits, mandarina. Aroma is on on dry malt, medium to high bitterness, pine, cara, metallic notes, medium bodied, guessed we were more on the resinous part.

Ein ganz tolles Bier. Sieht super aus: rötlich-bernstein-farben mit weichen Schaum. Vollmundig, sehr angenehm. Die Karbonisierung passt zu dem leichten Bier, das fruchtig schmeckt und ganz leicht herb am Schluss ist. Also nicht süß, sondern sehr erfrischend.
